text: Steve Rullo is an American soccer player. ==Early life and education== Rullo grew up in the suburbs of Anaheim, California.Mike Woitalla. “Becoming a Happy Bear in Berkeley.” Soccer America. While attending Servite High School, Rullo was named an All-Sunset League player in 1993. Rullo completed his undergraduate school at the University of California, Berkeley. While there, Rullo played for the university's soccer team where he was a midfielder and co-captain. During the 1996 season, he scored the game-winning overtime goal during the team's upset victory over second ranked University of Washington. That year, he was named an All-Mountain Pacific Sports Federation player and was named Team MVP at California. ==Professional soccer== Rullo played for the San Jose Clash of the MLS and the California Jaguars of the USISL A-League in the 1997 season, during which he scored one goal and got two assists. In 1998, he then competed in the MLS Player Combine. Following his career, he received his MBA from Villanova University, and has become an Ironman triathlete. ==Career== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ |- style="background:#B0C4DE;" ! Year ! Team !
